page.title: 04VILLAGE SCHOOL CLOSURES
page.content: This area once had two thriving little Church schools. That at{Cliffords {Mesne}was founded in 1860 as a two teacher school with about 40 pupils on its roll. It closed about 50 years ago and was purchased by the village. It now serves as the Village Hall. The school at{Aston Ingham}was endowed in 1738 but was probably founded several years before this. At one time it provided places for 120 children, but these numbers dwindled steadily especially after the setting up of separate secondary education schools. The school eventually closed in 1981 and is at present for sale. Chilldren from Cliffords Mesne now attend schools in Newent whilst those from Aston Ingham go either to Lea or Gorsley at the Infant-Junior stage and to Ross-on-Wye at secondary level.
